Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences

Mary Morrison Textile Art, Design and Fashion - BA (Hons)
I’ve had such an amazing 4 years of university and I have to say a massive thank you to all my tutors and friends who have helped me through, I couldn’t have got this far without your support. Congratulations Class of 2020!

Mary Morrison Textile Art, Design and Fashion - BA (Hons)
Katie Ireland Textile Art, Design and Fashion - BA (Hons)
Thank you to everyone who has helped and encouraged me during my 3 years at Ulster! Not just the lecturers, technicians and other staff from the Textile Art, Design and Fashion course who have been amazing! But also the UUSU staff, Enterprise team, careers team and so many others whoâ€¦

Read more of this testimonial

Thank you to everyone who has helped and encouraged me during my 3 years at Ulster! Not just the lecturers, technicians and other staff from the Textile Art, Design and Fashion course who have been amazing! But also the UUSU staff, Enterprise team, careers team and so many others who have always gone above and beyond in their jobs and who make the uni experience at UU so wonderful! There have been so many opportunities that I have been able to avail of that I never could have imagined before starting UU. The journey has been incredible - and you're not getting rid of me yet! I'm coming back next year for a postgrad. Yay! There have been so many incredible experiences, people I have met and learning opportunities, and it makes me so proud to be a UU Belfast School of Art graduate. Special thanks to my team from our start-up MÃ¡la Belfast - love you guys! You've helped make final year incredible, even lock down! And to the incredible friends I've met at UU - especially the ones who were there from the very beginning. Who would have thought that the people you meet on the very first day would be the ones there on the last! So proud of everyone graduating this year - especially during a global pandemic! Very well done to us all *claps enthusiastically* I can't wait to see what our futures hold xx "I want to be defined by the things that I love not the things that I hate... ...you are what you love." -T.Swift (Daylight)

Katie Ireland Textile Art, Design and Fashion - BA (Hons)
Margaret Cooke Photography with Video - BA (Hons)
Approaching my 67th birthday and just completed my three-year degree. To accompany my Student ID card, I had my Seniors Bus Pass, but never got double discount - not for the want of trying. I benefited from the banter of my younger peers, but shocked that some had never heardâ€¦

Read more of this testimonial

Approaching my 67th birthday and just completed my three-year degree. To accompany my Student ID card, I had my Seniors Bus Pass, but never got double discount - not for the want of trying. I benefited from the banter of my younger peers, but shocked that some had never heard of the 'man in black' Johnny Cash ðŸ˜Š. Enjoyed the highs and lows of Uni life and the new experience of online learning introduced by the onset of Covid-19. Having retired from Ulster University as a staff member to take up my degree, it was good to be on the other side of the fence for a change. Life is like a camera, focus on what's important, capture the good times, develop from the negatives, and if things don't work out, take another shot. Congrats to my fellow students. Cheers

Margaret Cooke Photography with Video - BA (Hons)
Oriana Firgau Product Design - BA (Hons)
It has already been five years since I started at Ulster and I can't believe how fast time has gone. First I did Foundation Year which was one of the coolest experiences I've had to date. There I met some wonderful people that I call my friends today! Also Iâ€¦

Read more of this testimonial

It has already been five years since I started at Ulster and I can't believe how fast time has gone. First I did Foundation Year which was one of the coolest experiences I've had to date. There I met some wonderful people that I call my friends today! Also I met Louise, who was the kindest, funniest and most straightforward tutor I've ever had who helped me gain so much insight about what I wanted to do in my future. Since I can remember Graphic Design has always been my north, but after a 3 hour workshop at the Product Design department, my heart was split in two and that's how I ended up doing a 4 year degree in Product Design (international exchange year to Belgium included). There I had really incredible tutors Dom, Martin and Tom who guided and taught me so much! Today I'm very happy for having completed my degree. However, something feels a little empty after not being able to finish our programme as we all looked forward to doing it together. Can't wait until we all can meet again and have that final reunion to officially say bye to a wonderful era, amazing people and the greatest of experiences. (Photo: Product Design - First day of class - September 2016)

Oriana Firgau Product Design - BA (Hons)
